title: The OR and NOT Gates
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The OR and NOT Gates.

hook.text: A fire alarm triggers if smoke is detected or if someone pulls the lever. Either one works.

buildup.text: An OR gate outputs 1 when at least one input is 1. Both off means the output is 0.

discovery.text: A NOT gate flips the input. Give it 1, it returns 0. Give it 0, it returns 1.

climax.text: Every computer ever built can be reduced to combinations of these three basic operations.
